channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: VC Mike Ghaffary is looking for the job-creating AI startup that doesn’t yet exist
item.description: Ghaffary is looking to fund startups using AI to create high-paying jobs, rather than replace them. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For person...

item.title: Microsoft Copilot: Everything you need to know about Microsoft’s AI
item.description: In this post, we explain the many Microsoft Copilots available and what they do, and highlight the key differences between each. © 2024 TechCrunch. Al...

item.title: 8 Best Streaming Devices for TVs (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Should you get a Roku, Amazon Fire TV, Chromecast, Apple TV, or Google TV Streamer? We've tested them all, and these are worth your money.

item.title: 2025: The Year of the AI App
item.description: The real competition in AI isn’t about foundation models. It’s about apps built on top of those models.

item.title: German court orders X to give data access to democracy researchers ahead of federal elections
item.description: Under European Union law, X is one of a handful of major social media platforms that has a duty to facilitate public interest researchers’ access to s...

item.title: Amazon deletes ‘inclusion and diversity’ language in latest filing
item.description: Amazon is the latest tech company to remove references to “inclusion and diversity” from its 10-K report. The filing has removed reference to diversit...

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs joins Amazon in backing nuclear startup X-Energy in $700M round
item.description: X-Energy is one of many nuclear startups to have benefitted from the AI-driven data center boom. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal ...

item.title: DOGE Is Now Inside the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
item.description: DOGE staffers will get read-only access to CFPB data, systems, and equipment, according to an internal email reviewed by WIRED.

item.title: Photopea Is a Free Photoshop Alternative That Runs in the Browser
item.description: When you need to edit photos, you don't have to download expensive or complicated software. Photopea is free to use, easy to grasp, and does most of w...

item.title: PreSonus Quantum HD Review: A Seamless Recording Tool
item.description: These affordable pro-tier audio interfaces are perfect for studio owners and traveling musicians alike.
